channel.title: miljko tweets
channel.description: A feed of recent tweets from miljko.

item.description: üìö Fooled by hindsight bias. This one is for anyone who thinks lockdowns and school closures in the spring of 2020 were a mistake. Making ex post ‚Äúpredictions‚Äù is infinitely easier than ex ante, and gives you a false sense of confidence to boot. Dangerous and stupid. https://t.co/q5yHrHQ4zy
@timtriche Not the same but close enough https://t.co/EUt8i82Klq

Several imprecisions in this essay on IRBs should not detract from its key point: social sciences don‚Äôt need IRB oversight, biomedicine needs it to be less byzantine and more transparent. Status quo is untenable. https://t.co/ovrddHZBFT
üìö Taleb the prophet, writing about cryptobros and the summer of 2022 back in the early 2000s. Financial instruments come and go but human stupidity and greed are forever. https://t.co/17Qmi2OcV8

Give a lecture once and you help a few hundred people (if you‚Äôre lucky). Post the lecture to YouTube and you help millions. 7 years later, I am yet to find a better guide to academic writing. NB: it‚Äôs good to have a live audience. https://t.co/7PhQt2RTRA
